overview: After completion of this subject, students will have the knowledge and skill to perform and interpret focused clinical ultrasound of commonly encountered conditions of the arterial and venous systems and be able to write a structured report. Students will perform, interpret, write a report and submit a log-book of 15 ultrasound studies and ultrasound-guided cannulation of peripheral and/or central arteries and veins on patients and/or simulators and interpret and report an additional 10 on-line ultrasound studies.
ilo: Comprehensively understand the indications, uses and limitations of focused clinical ultrasound in assessment of the vascular assessment including arterial aneurysm, stenosis and deep venous thrombosis.

Perform ultrasound to diagnose commonly occurring pathology of the carotid artery, abdominal aorta, the arteries of the upper and lower limb and the lower limb veins and write a structured ultrasound report on patients and/or simulators
Perform ultrasound-guided cannulation of peripheral and/or central arteries and veins
Evaluate the requirements for training, competence and certification of vascular diagnostic and procedural ultrasound
generic_skills: Improved procedural skills for students who select a practical subject
Improved written skills and problem-solving skills

Prerequisites.content: Note: these can be taken concurrently (at the same time)

Inherent requirements (core participatio.content: Adequate visual acuity is required to perform and interpret clinical ultrasound. A  student is expected to demonstrate: Sufficient visual acuity to perform the required range of skills, including reading ultrasound monitors across a bed and interpreting ultrasound images on standard commercially available ultrasound machines.

Gross and fine motor skills are required in performing clinical ultrasound. A student is expected to demonstrate adequate gross and fine motor skills to perform focused ultrasound whilst avoiding injury to patients, colleagues and self.

assessment.brief: Multiple-choice questions following each tutorial (25 MCQ)
Interpretation of 10 online case studies assessed by structured MCQ pertaining to each case (50 MCQ)
Complete a logbook of 15 focused ultrasound studies and 5 ultrasound-guided procedures on either patients or simulators
assessment.hurdle: Students must submit a completed logbook of 15 focused ultrasound studies and 5 ultrasound-guided procedures on either patients or simulators to pass this subject

assessment.brief: Open-book examination of 25 MCQ. Equivalent to a total 35-40 minutes and 625 words assessment
